description: Lists the IAM users that have the specified path prefix. If no path prefix is specified, the operation returns all users in the AWS account.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Attackers may use the ListUsers API call to discover valid user accounts within an AWS environment. Knowledge of valid accounts can help in attempts to compromise or leverage these accounts.
Knowledge of IAM users can help an attacker identify which processes might be running under specific user accounts, assisting in further exploitation or lateral movement within the cloud environment.

incidents.description: Incident report: From CLI to console, chasing an attacker in AWS
Tales from the cloud trenches: Amazon ECS is the new EC2 for crypto mining
Muddled Libra’s Evolution to the Cloud

researchLinks.description: Following attackers’ (Cloud)trail in AWS: Methodology and findings in the wild

securityImplications: Attackers might use ListUsers to enumerate IAM users for further attacks, such as adding keys or creating a login profile for persistence.
